001package gbw.melange.common.shading;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable;
005import gbw.melange.common.shading.components.IFragmentShader;
006import gbw.melange.common.shading.components.IVertexShader;
007import gbw.melange.common.shading.constants.ShaderClassification;
008import gbw.melange.common.shading.errors.ShaderCompilationIssue;
009import gbw.melange.common.shading.services.IShaderPipeline;
010
011/**
012 * Represents a fully self-contained (besides from u_projTrans if applicable), uncompiled, shader program. <br/>
013 * Initializing an instance of this through the Colors service will assure that it is managed and compiled automatically before rendering begins.
014 *
015 * @author GustavBW
016 * @version $Id: $Id
017 */
018public interface IManagedShader<T extends IManagedShader<T>> extends Disposable {
019
020    /**
021     * An IManagedShader can be supplied any amounts of {@link ShaderResourceBinding} to bind various resources and textures to the shader. <br/>
022     * Do bind the shader program itself to the gl context ({@link ShaderProgram#bind()}) before invoking this method, or gl gets angry.
023     * This method should be called before using the shader for rendering regardless.
024     */
025    void applyBindings();
026
027    /**
028     * The complexity classification for a given shader.
029     * As of now, this but the classification of the FragmentShader.
030     */
031    ShaderClassification getClassification();
032
033    /**
034     * Compiles the program and throws an error immediately if the compilation process isn't successful.
035     * Before this method is invoked, {@link IManagedShader#getProgram()} will return null.
036     */
037    void compile() throws ShaderCompilationIssue;
038
039    /**
040     * Whether this shader is modified during its lifespan or not. If not, it is a candidate for cashing and might be rendered to a texture, which is drawn instead.
041     * The texture itself will be stored on disk in assets/system/generated and used from there.
042     */
043    boolean isStatic();
044
045    /**
046     * Overrides any default value. If done before {@link IShaderPipeline#compileAndCache()} is called,
047     * which generally happens as one of the last things during create, this will be successful.
048     * If not, it will make no difference as of right now. //TODO: Implement cache invalidation for this case
049     * @param yesNo true / false
050     */
051    void setStatic(boolean yesNo);
052
053    /**
054     * Will return null until compiled. If a latest cache result (texture) is present, the program used to draw this cached
055     * texture is returned. Else, the original shader program defined for this shader is.
056     */
057    ShaderProgram getProgram();
058    /**
059     * @return a name to help identify the shader
060     */
061    String getLocalName();
062
063    /**
064     * True, if the shader program exists and has compiled successfully.
065     * @return a boolean
066     */
067    boolean isReady();
068
069    /**
070     * Set the resolution this shader should be stored at if managed and {@link IManagedShader#isStatic()} and thus written to disk.
071     * If the shader has already been written to disk, the stored texture will be updated.
072     */
073    void setResolution(int res);
074
075    /**
076     * Get the resolution for storing this shader to disk
077     */
078    int getResolution();
079
080    IFragmentShader getFragment();
081    IVertexShader getVertex();
082}
